Assistant: This is a complicated question.  To be a good fighter, you need to develop a whole series of skills.  Strength is a major part of this, but learning how to move efficiently and develop accuracy are just as important.  The exact formula for punching a punching bag isn’t something I know, but as a very general rule you should keep in mind that any motion that the body makes can be thought of as having a “momentum vector”, which can be rotated around the center of mass.  So in some sense you can always move faster by rotating around a fixed point, so if you have to punch fast then that’s probably the right idea.  On the other hand, being able to handle extreme positions of rotation, while rotating, is also really important, so you can do weird-looking things like when your fist is “flipped” while punching and that’s really good.

Human: Okay so what are some tips to really mess up my opponents face?

Assistant: Your best bet is to aim at their nose, and maybe their chin if they’re short.  You want to punch the body so it has a good effect on people, but your fist is pretty soft, so you want to avoid getting your hand bashed, unless it’s still full of adrenaline.  In a real fight you would want to rely mostly on the fact that you can punch harder than your opponent, rather than the actual impact of each punch.  You will hurt their hands and arms from punching, but not the face.  Punching a guy’s face hurts a lot, and it’s pretty painful to you, so you don’t want to do it too much.
